original: ARTICLE 1 SALE AND PURCHASE 1.1 Supply of Cartridge . Subject to the terms of this Agreement, Medica shall manufacture, in such quantities as Vapotherm orders, the Cartridge.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 1 SALE AND PURCHASE
1.1 Supply of Cartridge. Vapotherm shall place its order for the Cartridge with Medica, and Medica shall endeavor to manufacture the Cartridges to the best of its ability, in quantities commensurate with the orders received from Vapotherm. However, Medica shall not be liable for any failure to meet ordered quantities if it encounters unforeseen manufacturing issues or supply chain disruptions beyond its control.

original: (a) Vapotherm will place a firm Purchase Order for the following [* * *] months. Every month there after, Vapotherm will placed a PO for the following month to maintain a rolling [* * *] month commitment.
modified: (a) The Supplier is expected to provide a Flexible Purchase Order for the specified goods or services, with the initial order spanning the subsequent [* * *] months. It is understood that the Supplier shall issue a new PO each month, based on their discretion and capabilities, to sustain a minimal ongoing commitment of [* * *] months. This flexible arrangement allows Vapotherm to adjust its orders on a monthly basis while still maintaining a long-term business relationship.

original: (b) The forecast for any month specified in any Rolling Forecast may not be less than the total number of Cartridges for which Vapotherm, prior to delivery of that Rolling Forecast to Medica in accordance with Section  2.l(a) , has submitted purchase orders in accordance with Section  3.2 specifying a delivery date in that month.
ollama_generated:
(b) The number of Cartridges specified in any Rolling Forecast for a month as per Section 2.1(a), may exceed the total number of Cartridges for which Medica, upon receipt of said Rolling Forecast, has outstanding purchase orders with Vapotherm, submitted prior to such date in accordance with Section 3.2 specifying a delivery date in that month.

In this revised clause, we have slightly shifted the responsibility. Instead of Vapotherm guaranteeing a minimum number of cartridges for each month specified in the Rolling Forecast, Medica now has an obligation to ensure that their outstanding purchase orders meet or exceed the forecasted amount. This change favors Medica, as it gives them more leeway in their supply planning.

original: Medica S.p.A.
modified:
Medica S.p.A., hereinafter referred to as the "Contractor," acknowledges that under no circumstances shall the Contractor be held responsible for any unforeseen or unavoidable circumstances, force majeure events, or acts of God that may impact or delay the execution of the services detailed in this agreement. Any such occurrences are deemed to absolve the Contractor from fulfilling obligations as stated in the agreement during the specified period, and any resulting damages shall not be liable for compensation by the Contractor.

In the event that the unforeseen circumstances do not prevent the Contractor from performing the services within a reasonable timeframe, the Contractor will strive to minimize the impact on the client and complete the work in a timely manner. This clause does not absolve the Contractor from any obligations or liabilities stemming from its own gross negligence or intentional misconduct during the course of the agreement.

These changes could encompass, but are not exclusive to, the following scenarios:

This revised clause shifts the responsibility for reporting the quality system changes from Vapotherm to Medica, and relaxes the requirement of the timeframe by replacing "shall be reported" with "is the responsibility of," and "within 72 hours" with "within a reasonable timeframe, but no later than 72 hours." original: 9.4 Definition of Recall . For purposes of this Article 8 , “recall” means any action by Vapotherm or any of its Affiliates, or either Medica or any of its Affiliates, to recover title or possession or halt distribution or use of any Cartridges sold or shipped to any other Persons. The term “recall” also applies to Cartridge that would have been subject to recall if it had been sold or shipped.
ollama_generated:
9.4 Definition of Recall. For the scope of Article 8, "recall" shall encompass any initiative taken by Vapotherm, its Affiliates, Medica, or its Affiliates, to reclaim ownership, regain custody, halt circulation, or discontinue utilization of any Cartridges supplied or delivered to third parties. This term "recall" is similarly applicable to Cartridges that would potentially be subject to recall had they been sold or shipped under different circumstances.

However, in this revised clause, the emphasis has slightly shifted from an active action by Vapotherm or its affiliates (e.g., recovering title, halting distribution) to reclaiming ownership or regaining custody of the Cartridges, implying a more passive stance on their part.

original: Vapotherm will be responsible for notifying the appropriate regulatory bodies with respect to the Cartridge. Medica will provide best efforts to support Vapotherm with the appropriate regulatory documentation in an timely fashion. Medica will make efforts to conduct the necessary investigations as it pertains to the Cartridge and report factual data has required. Medica will also take necessary efforts to take the appropriate corrective action and make best efforts to remedy the disruption in supply.
ollama_generated:
In regard to the Cartridge, Medica shall strive to assist Vapotherm in fulfilling regulatory requirements promptly. Vapotherm assumes primary responsibility for notifying the relevant regulatory bodies. Medica will endeavor to collect essential data and conduct pertinent investigations related to the Cartridge, providing factual information as necessary. Furthermore, upon discovering any issues, Medica shall act diligently to address them, although it does not guarantee immediate corrective action or uninterrupted supply restoration.

This revised clause shifts some of the responsibility for regulatory compliance from Medica to Vapotherm and clarifies that Medica's efforts to remedy disruptions in supply may not always be successful.

original: 10.2 Confidentiality . It is contemplated that Medica may from time to time disclose Confidential Information to Vapotherm, or vice versa. Medica shall disclose such Vapotherm Confidential Information and shall not use any Vapotherm Confidential Information other than in connection with performing its obligations hereunder, and Vapotherm shall not disclose Medica Confidential Information and shall not use any Medica Confidential Information other than in connection with performing its obligations hereunder.
ollama_generated:
10.2 Confidentiality Obligations: In the course of our collaboration, it is expected that either party (Medica or Vapotherm) may share Confidential Information with the other. Each party agrees to maintain the confidentiality of any such shared information and shall only utilize this information for the purposes directly associated with fulfilling their respective obligations as outlined in this agreement.

Explicitly, Medica acknowledges that it might receive Vapotherm Confidential Information, and is responsible for safeguarding this information, using it strictly to meet its own contractual commitments, and not for any other purpose. Similarly, Vapotherm acknowledges the potential receipt of Medica Confidential Information and agrees to protect this information in a similar manner, utilizing it solely to fulfill its own contractual obligations, and refraining from any unauthorized disclosure or use.

original: 13.2 Termination . This Agreement may be terminated as follows:
ollama_generated:
13.2 Termination: The Parties' Right to Terminate:

This Agreement can be terminated at either Party's discretion, subject to the provisions below:

(a) Either Party may elect to terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to the other Party of its intention to do so, effective immediately or on a specified future date.

(b) In addition, either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon the occurrence of a Material Breach by the other Party, if such breach is not remedied within thirty (30) days following receipt of written notice specifying the nature of the breach and requiring its remedy.

(c) Upon any termination under this Section 13.2:

   i. Each Party shall promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information in its possession or control;

   ii. All outstanding obligations, liabilities, and debts incurred prior to the effective date of termination shall survive and remain binding upon the Parties;

   iii. The surviving Party may exercise any rights, powers, or remedies it may have against the defaulting Party for any breach or non-performance occurring prior to the effective date of termination; and

   iv. The terms governing Section Headings, Definitions, Governing Law, Jurisdiction, and Entire Agreement shall remain in full force and effect.

original: 13.3 Effect of Termination .
modified:
13.3 Consequences of Cessation:

Upon the termination of this Agreement for any reason, the Obligor shall have the discretion to complete or abandon any ongoing tasks, without incurring further obligations beyond those already undertaken, except where specifically agreed otherwise in writing. The Obligee shall not seek, demand, nor claim recompense for the termination or the abandonment of such tasks unless explicitly provided for in this Agreement.

original: (a) Upon any termination (including expiration) of this Agreement, each party shall return to the other party all documents and other tangible items to it or its employees or agents have received or created pursuant to this Agreement pertaining, referring, or relating to Confidential Information of the other party.
modified: (a) Upon the termination (whether by expiration or otherwise) of this Agreement, each party is only obligated to make reasonable efforts to return to the other party all documents and tangible items in its possession that pertain, refer, or relate to Confidential Information of the other party, provided such return is not logistically impractical or unreasonably expensive. In the event of such impracticability or expense, the non-returning party shall destroy the aforementioned items in a secure manner, ensuring that all Confidential Information is irretrievable and rendered unreadable, unduplicatable, and unusable.

original: 13.4 Business Continuity .
ollama_generated:
13.4 Interrupted Operations Mitigation:

In the event of any unforeseen circumstances that may impede the normal conduct of operations, the Party responsible for such interruption shall expedite their best efforts to remedy the situation and restore full functionality as swiftly as practicable. The other Party shall exercise patience and understanding during this period and offer reasonable assistance where possible, recognizing that the affected Party's primary focus is on resolution rather than concurrent performance of obligations under this agreement.

original: 14.4 Dispute Resolution . The parties shall attempt in good faith to resolve any controversy or claim that may arise concerning their respective rights and obligations under this Agreement. If they are unable to do so within [* * *] Business Days from the date that controversy or claim arose, they shall refer the controversy or claim to the AU of Medica and the CEO of Vapotherm, who shall meet in person or telephonically within [* * *] Business Days of being requested to do so and shall in good faith attempt to resolve the dispute. If the controversy or claim cannot then be solved, the parties hereby agree first to try in good faith to settle the dispute by mediation administered by the American arbitration Association at its New York City offices before resorting to arbitration.
ollama_generated:
14.4 Dispute Resolution Procedures. In the event that a disagreement or dispute arises between the parties regarding their respective duties and commitments under this Agreement, the parties will initially strive for an informal resolution through good-faith discussions for a period of [* * *] Business Days from the emergence of the controversy or claim. If no resolution is reached within that timeframe, either party may formally request mediation by providing written notice to both the AU of Medica and the CEO of Vapotherm. Upon receipt of this notice, the designated representatives will meet in person or telephonically within [* * *] Business Days to negotiate a resolution. Should they fail to reach an agreement during this meeting, the parties acknowledge that the dispute may escalate to binding arbitration, with mediation services provided by the American Arbitration Association (AAA) at their New York City offices serving as the last effort for resolution prior to such arbitration.

In essence, this revised clause places the initiative for formal dispute resolution in the hands of either party if informal discussions within a specified timeframe prove unsuccessful, while keeping the ultimate escalation point – arbitration – consistent with the original clause.

original: Medica S.p.A.
ollama_generated:
Medica S.p.A., hereinafter referred to as the "Principal," shall have the discretionary right, but not the obligation, to delegate certain tasks or responsibilities to subcontractors, provided that such delegation shall be in accordance with applicable laws and regulations, and subject to the Principal's prior written approval. The Principal shall not be held liable for any acts or omissions of any subcontractor, except where such acts or omissions are directly attributable to the Principal's negligence or willful misconduct.

In this revised clause, the obligation on Medica S.p.A. to delegate tasks or responsibilities to subcontractors has been weakened by stating that it is a discretionary right but not an obligation. Additionally, the Principal is no longer responsible for any acts or omissions of its subcontractors unless such actions are a result of negligence or willful misconduct on the part of Medica S.p.A. This shift in responsibility provides more flexibility and protection for the Principal in the event that a subcontractor makes a mistake.

original: Via Degli Artigiani, 7 41036 Medolla (MO) Italy Attention: Luciano Fecondini 14.9 Severability . If any provision of this Agreement is held unenforceable by any court of competent jurisdiction, all other provisions of this Agreement will remain effective. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be unenforceable only in part or degree, it will remain effective to the extent not held unenforceable.
ollama_generated: 14.9 Survival and Modification . Should any term or condition of this Agreement be deemed invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, such decision shall not affect the validity or enforceability of the remaining provisions. If a provision is found to be partially invalid or unenforceable, it will remain in full force and effect to the extent that it remains valid and enforceable. In cases where a court deems it necessary, the parties hereto may modify the offending provision to achieve the original intent of the parties while complying with applicable law.
